roleset.name: to make into a commodity, commercialize

example.name: transitive
example.text: In his book The Art of Life , the humorist Lin Yutang noted how commercial advertising has commodified virtually every inch of a woman 's body , right down to the last line and the last painted toenail .

propbank.arg: virtually every inch of a woman 's body , right down to the last line and the last painted toenail

example.name: with instrument
example.text: Capitalism commodifies everything with glitzy advertising and tacky slogans .

propbank.arg: with glitzy advertising and tacky slogans

example.name: Arg1 only
example.text: i think this issue is only valuable for the purposes of supporting commoditization of CO2 .

example.name: All args.
example.text: Recorded history is ripe with evidence of their commoditization of violence , e.g. imperialism .

roleset.note: COMMODIFY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'commodify' based on survey of sentences in ectb2. Comparison with 'commercialize.' No VerbNet entry. (from commodify.01-v predicate notes)
COMMODITIZATION-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01. Comparison to verb entry commodify.01. No VN, FN. (from commoditization.01-n)
